Cyclist Magazine Podcast episode 98: African cycling pioneer David Kinjah, the man who made Chris Froome

On this week’s episode of the Cyclist Magazine Podcast, James and Will are joined by David Kinjah, Kenyan former pro cyclist who was the first black African to ride for a European team. He also competed at World Championships and Commonweath Games, founded the Safari Simbaz Cycling Trust and mentored many young African cyclists including one Christopher Clive Froome.

Kinjah talks us through his journey into pro cycling, his experiences in Europe – including an interesting first Worlds experience and his time with Italian team Index-Alexia, what Chris Froome was like in the early years, and the state of African cycling in 2024.

Interview starts at 5:47.
